title: U.S. stock futures waver as earnings season heats up
text:
* Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average YM00 rose 25 points, or 0.1%, to 34,338.

* S&P 500 futures ES00 gained 5 points, or 0.1%, to 4,391.75.

* Nasdaq-100 futures NQ00 were up 24 points, or 0.2%, at 13,931.75.

On a quiet Monday with several international markets shut, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA fell 40 points, or 0.1%, to 34412, while the S&P 500 SPX edged down 1 point and the Nasdaq Composite COMP lost 0.1%. The S&P 500 has dropped for seven of the last nine sessions.

What's driving markets

This week is one of the busiest in the U.S. quarterly earnings reporting season, after a raft of banks posted somewhat disappointing results last week.

Johnson & Johnson JNJ headlined the companies reporting ahead of Tuesday's open, and International Business Machines Corp. IBM and Netflix Inc. NFLX report after the close.

Netflix shares have been hammered this year, skidding 44%, on investor concern about their subscription numbers.

The average implied earnings move for S&P 500 companies based on options prices is plus or minus 4%, according to strategists at UBS. That's a bit lower than the fourth quarter of 2021, but above the 10-year average, the strategists said.

Data showed U.S. March housing starts and permits each roseby less than 1%.

The U.S. economic calendar also features a speech by Chicago President Charles Evans. The International Monetary Fund is due to release its world economic outlook, a day after the World Bank slashed its global growth forecast.

The airlines sector will be in the spotlight as well after a U.S. federal judge halted the mask mandate on planes, a move that the industry championed.

Companies in focus

* Johnson & Johnson shares were little changed after the pharmaceutical and consumer products company topped first-quarter profit expectations but missed on revenue, and cut its full-year outlook.

* American Campus Communities Inc. ACC on Tuesday confirmed a report by The Wall Street Journal that it agreed to be acquired by Blackstone Inc. BX in a deal that values the student housing company at about $12.8 billion including debt. American Campus shares rose nearly 13%, while Blackstone shares were up 0.9%.

* Hasbro Inc. HAS shares rose 0.5% after the toymaker missed first-quarter profit estimates.

How other assets are trading

* The yield on the 10-year Treasury note BX:TMUBMUSD10Y rose 3.3 basis pints to 2.895%. Yields and debt prices move opposite each other.

* The ICE U.S. Dollar Index DXY, a measure of the currency against a basket of six major rivals, was flat.

* Bitcoin BTCUSD rose 0.3% to trade just shy of $41,000.

* Oil futures CL.1 pulled back from April highs, with the U.S. benchmark down 2.4% near $105 a barrel. Gold futures GC00 edged own 0.2% to trade near $1,981 an ounce.

* The Stoxx Europe 600 XX:SXXP fell 1.2% as European traders returned from a four-day Easter weekend, while London's FTSE 100 UK:UKX lost 0.4%.

* The Shanghai Composite CN:SHCOMP posted a loss of less than 0.1%, while the Hang Seng Index HK:HSI fell 2.3% in Hong Kong and Japan's Nikkei 225 JP:NIK rose 0.7%.

U.S. stock futures waver as earnings season heats up
